intro: Calymella, commonly known as the "southern star" or "Australian star," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and features small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plants are shrubs or subshrubs with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Calymella species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapted to withstand dry conditions. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
